bug.author: scimad
bug.summary: Number of edge not showing up in Global Optimization using Gauss-Newton
bug.description:
While using o3d.registration.GlobalOptimizationGaussNewton() as method for o3d.registration.global_optimization(), I noticed that the number of edges in verbose was missing as shown below. <denchmark-code>[Open3D DEBUG] Validating PoseGraph - finished. [Open3D DEBUG] [GlobalOptimizationGaussNewton] Optimizing PoseGraph having 4 nodes and %d edges. [Open3D DEBUG] Line process weight : 35.426347 </denchmark-code>
Things are okay while using o3d.registration.GlobalOptimizationLevenbergMarquardt() method. Environment:
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Python version: 3.6.8 Open3D version: v0.8.0. Compiled & Installed from source
